data: ICU General Admission Medical / Surgical EKM
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete Admission or Transfer Medication Reconciliation
Research coordinator is able to screen patient for study eligibility
MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater, pH goal: greater than or equal to 7.30, SpO2 goal: 92% or greater
q4h, if patient expresses pain, use Numeric Rating Scale (goal less than 4). If patient exhibits signs of pain, use Behavioural Pain Scale (goal less than 6)
Insert 2 large bore IV's unless already in place
Contraindications to nasal insertion include facial or head trauma. Order X-ray post tube placement to confirm position, if required
Tube for feeding, insert large bore. Check gastric residual volume q4h
Tube to Clamped, insert large bore. Check gastric residual volume q4h
No suction, Tube for feeding, check gastric residual volume q4h

RASS goal of 0, Alert and Calm
RASS goal of -1, Drowsy, sustained eye opening and eye contact for more than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -2, Light sedation, eye opening and eye contact for less than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -3, Moderate sedation, movement but no eye contact to voice
RASS goal of -4, Deep sedation, no response to voice, only rousable to pain
dose range: 0.5 to 6 mg, IV, q3min, PRN agitation, drug form: inj
If Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist (ICDSC) is greater than or equal to 4, consider starting delirium therapy
BID, to be done at 0600 and 1600 and as needed

Urgent, Reason: Other (please specify), Critical Care Admission
Urgent, Reason: Critical Care Admission; line and tube placement, Transport: Portable
General, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 6-8 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-10 cmH2O, Titrate to critical care goals
ARDS, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 4-6 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-12 cmH2O, Titrate to critical care goals
Bariatric BMI greater than 35-40, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 4-8 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-15 cmH2O, Consider ordering: Esophageal Balloon Monitoring
COPD /Asthma (Obstructive), Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 4-6 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-10 cmH2O, Consider the orders: Autopeep measurements q4h, Ventolin and Atrovent
Non-traumatic Neurological Injury, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 6-8 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-10 cmH2O, PaCO2 > 30, PaCO2 < 45, RT to adjust ventilation as per clinical status
Refractory Respiratory Failure, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 4-6 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 12-20 cmH2O
Spinal Cord Injury, Mode: A/C or P/C, Vt: 6-10 mL/kg, Max P: 30 cmH2O, PEEP: 5-10 cmH2O, Consider ordering: Vital Capacity
IPAP (cmH2O): 10 to 16 cm H2O, EPAP (cmH2O): 5 to 10 cm H2O, Titrate to critical care goals
Wean as per RT - simple wean
Wean as per RT - strength and conditioning wean
